summary.text: Return value for background tasks.
The task failed.
The task finished successfully.
Availability status for background tasks
Background tasks are available for the app.
Background tasks are unavailable.
Options for registering a background task

Inexact interval in minutes between subsequent repeats of the background tasks. The final
interval may differ from the specified one to minimize wakeups and battery usage.
- Defaults to once every day on Android (The minimum interval is 15 minutes)
- On iOS the system will determine the interval.
Returns the status for the Background Task API. On web, it always returns
`BackgroundTaskStatus.Restricted`

,
while on native platforms it returns
`BackgroundTaskStatus.Available`
. There is

content.text: A BackgroundTaskStatus enum value or null if not available.

summary.text: Registers a background task with the given name. Registered tasks are saved in persistent storage and restored once the app is initialized.
Name of the task to register. The task needs to be defined first - see [
`TaskManager.defineTask`
task-manager/#taskmanagerdefinetasktaskname-taskexecutor

)
for more details.
An object containing the background task options.

When in debug mode this function will trigger running the background tasks.
This function will only work for apps built in debug mode.

content.text: A promise which fulfils when the task is triggered.

summary.text: Unregisters a background task, so the application will no longer be executing this task.

content.text: A promise which fulfils when the task is fully unregistered.

summary.text: Name of the task to unregister.
